The #CARESAct:
‚úÖDefers student loan payments until Sept. 30
‚úÖDelays interest on student loans for six months
‚úÖAllows for businesses to offer a tax-free student loan payment

Student loan debt is now the 2nd highest form of consumer debt. The #CARESAct did 3 major things to help people with student debt right now, including a temporary version of my bill (HR 1043) to allow employers to help pay student debt. https://t.co/H12GeXBouK

@TransportGOP @RepSamGraves 6. Ensuring state flexibility ‚Äì Each state has its own unique & disparate infrastructure needs, & top-down mandates frequently fail to account for this natural disparity. States, in partnership w/ local partners, generally know best how to prioritize & address their needs.

@TransportGOP @RepSamGraves 5. Prioritizing core programs & functions of our existing fed surface transportation programs ‚Äì fixing & improving the Nation‚Äôs core system of highways & bridges, & facilitating interstate commerce & movement of freight & people, are critical & shouldn't be jeopardized.

@TransportGOP @RepSamGraves 4. Addressing the infrastructure needs of America‚Äôs rural communities ‚Äì 71% of U.S. public road lane-mileage is in rural America. Any increased investment in federal funding must ensure that small & rural communities are getting a fair shake & are not being left behind.

@TransportGOP @RepSamGraves 3. Streamlining the project delivery process to maximize available funding ‚Äì time is money, and reducing red tape in the project review and delivery process will yield better results for taxpayer investments in infrastructure and save money.

@TransportGOP @RepSamGraves 2. Incorporating innovative developments in technology to improve our infrastructure ‚Äì technological innovation has dramatic potential to increase transportation efficiency, improve safety and the environment, and create jobs. Our federal policies must better reflect this reality

@TransportGOP @RepSamGraves 1. Addressing the long-term sustainability of the Highway Trust Fund ‚Äì continuing the status quo and relying on the fuel taxes as the primary source of funding for the Highway Trust Fund is not a long-term solution to the Trust Fund‚Äôs ongoing solvency issues.

Many men and women are working longer in life and ensuring our laws are keeping up with this is important. The Protecting Older Workers Against Discrimination Act is a good, bipartisan bill and amendment that passed the House today.

Some research suggests that ageism at work begins at age 40 for women - 5 yrs earlier than men. I'm proud my amendment, which directs a study of this issue and for government agencies to provide best practices to prevent this, passed as part of this bill. https://t.co/MA6in1YnRX

RT @RepCloakroom: The Rep. Davis (R-IL) @RodneyDavis Amendment No. 2 was adopted by voice

Thank you to all our cosponsors for your bipartisan support @chelliepingree @RepStefanik @RepHaleyStevens @RepJenniffer @RepMarcyKaptur @RepSpanberger @BettyMcCollum04 @RepDeSaulnier @RepDavidTrone @RepChrisSmith @RepPeteStauber @HurdOnTheHill @RepBost
Employers should make, and have the right tools to make, conscious efforts to ensure that women have equal rights and opportunities in the workplace, regardless of their age.
The challenges that women face are not partisan issues, and together we can and should make every effort to address them.
This amendment requires DOL and the EEOC to study the impact and make recommendations for best practices to combat age discrimination of women in the workplace.
In fact, some research suggests that ageism at work begins at age 40 for women, five years earlier than men. This is unacceptable, and we must find ways to correct the problem.

@cspan According to a 2018 report from the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC), ‚Äúwomen, especially older women, but also those at middle age, were subjected to more age discrimination than older men.‚Äù
